DOC.brief_summary: Oro- or nasogastric tube feeding is safe and may be more physiologic than intravenous (IV) fluids in hospitalized infants with acute viral bronchiolitis.
DOC.brief_title: Intravenous Fluids Versus Naso/Orogastric-tube Feeding in Hospitalized Infants With Bronchiolitis
DOC.criteria: Infants with bronchiolitis < 6 months who need to be hospitalized and are not able to eat per os. Infants with severe bronchiolitis not allowed to get any gastric feeds or those that their parents will not sign an informed consent.
